properties.name: camel.component.jetty.allow-java-serialized-object
properties.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request uses context-type=application/x-java-serialized-object. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.continuation-timeout
properties.description: Allows to set a timeout in millis when using Jetty as consumer (server). By default Jetty uses 30000. You can use a value of = 0 to never expire. If a timeout occurs then the request will be expired and Jetty will return back a http error 503 to the client. This option is only in use when using Jetty with the Asynchronous Routing Engine.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.enable-jmx
properties.description: If this option is true, Jetty JMX support will be enabled for this endpoint.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the jetty component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.error-handler
properties.description: This option is used to set the ErrorHandler that Jetty server uses. The option is a org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.ErrorHandler type.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.header-filter-strategy
properties.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message. The option is a org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy type.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.http-binding
properties.description: Not to be used - use JettyHttpBinding instead. The option is a org.apache.camel.http.common.HttpBinding type.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.http-configuration
properties.description: Jetty component does not use HttpConfiguration. The option is a org.apache.camel.http.common.HttpConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.jetty-http-binding
properties.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.jetty.JettyHttpBinding, which are used to customize how a response should be written for the producer. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.jetty.JettyHttpBinding type.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.keystore
properties.description: Specifies the location of the Java keystore file, which contains the Jetty server's own X.509 certificate in a key entry.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.max-threads
properties.description: To set a value for maximum number of threads in server thread pool. Notice that both a min and max size must be configured.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.mb-container
properties.description: To use a existing configured org.eclipse.jetty.jmx.MBeanContainer if JMX is enabled that Jetty uses for registering mbeans. The option is a org.eclipse.jetty.jmx.MBeanContainer type.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.min-threads
properties.description: To set a value for minimum number of threads in server thread pool. Notice that both a min and max size must be configured.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.mute-exception
properties.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side the response's body won't contain the exception's stack trace.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.proxy-host
properties.description: To use a http proxy to configure the hostname.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.proxy-port
properties.description: To use a http proxy to configure the port number.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.request-buffer-size
properties.description: Allows to configure a custom value of the request buffer size on the Jetty connectors.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.request-header-size
properties.description: Allows to configure a custom value of the request header size on the Jetty connectors.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.response-buffer-size
properties.description: Allows to configure a custom value of the response buffer size on the Jetty connectors.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.response-header-size
properties.description: Allows to configure a custom value of the response header size on the Jetty connectors.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.send-server-version
properties.description: If the option is true, jetty will send the server header with the jetty version information to the client which sends the request. NOTE please make sure there is no any other camel-jetty endpoint is share the same port, otherwise this option may not work as expected.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.socket-connector-properties
properties.description: A map which contains general HTTP connector properties. Uses the same principle as sslSocketConnectorProperties.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.socket-connectors
properties.description: A map which contains per port number specific HTTP connectors. Uses the same principle as sslSocketConnectors.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters. The option is a org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters type.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.ssl-key-password
properties.description: The key password, which is used to access the certificate's key entry in the keystore (this is the same password that is supplied to the keystore command's -keypass option).

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.ssl-password
properties.description: The ssl password, which is required to access the keystore file (this is the same password that is supplied to the keystore command's -storepass option).

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.ssl-socket-connector-properties
properties.description: A map which contains general SSL connector properties.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.ssl-socket-connectors
properties.description: A map which contains per port number specific SSL connectors.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.thread-pool
properties.description: To use a custom thread pool for the server. This option should only be used in special circumstances. The option is a org.eclipse.jetty.util.thread.ThreadPool type.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.use-continuation
properties.description: Whether or not to use Jetty continuations for the Jetty Server.

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.use-global-ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters

properties.name: camel.component.jetty.use-x-forwarded-for-header
properties.description: To use the X-Forwarded-For header in HttpServletRequest.getRemoteAddr.
